Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Tranexamic Acid Administration Routes in Total Knee Arthroplasty

Trial_Design.evidence: 376 patients undergoing TKA were randomised into four groups

Intervention.evidence: randomised into four groups: IV only, IA only, low-dose combined (IV + IA injection of 1 g), and high-dose combined (IV + IA injection of 2 g)

Objective.evidence: evaluated the efficacy of different tranexamic acid administration routes in reducing total blood loss and allogeneic transfusion rates in total knee arthroplasty (TKA)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was total blood loss

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was conducted using a computer-generated sequence with allocation concealment

Blinding.evidence: Outcome assessors were blinded to group allocation

Number_Randomised.evidence: Between March 2014 and March 2015, 376 patients undergoing TKA were randomised

Harms.evidence: One patient in the IV-only group developed a symptomatic pulmonary embolism
